chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Salah I. Salahadyn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution to be paid first.  
Hearing 12/18/14 at 3:00 p.m.  Defendant to appear by video.

**12-18-14/ Dennis P. Moroney**
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution inthe amount of $4,014.57, to be paid, Joint & Several with co-defendant in case 14CF517, less any monies already applied from co-defendant's account.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

Pay restitution, plus DNA surcharge, all costs and disbursements. Restitution to be paid first. Bail to apply. Balance to be paid from prison funds.
AS CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  pay any balances remaining.   Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health assessment. Follow any treatment recommended.

No contact with the victim Frank A. or his family, their residence or place(s) of employment.
No contact with Universal Allah.
Remain alcohol free.
Remain free of controlled substanced other than those legally presribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental  or physical needs. Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/counseling.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail:  REMAND.

Defendant Salah I. Salahadyn in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised the Court that this case will proceed with a guilty plea on today's date.  State withdrew its proposed Amended Information filed on 10/01/14, and withdraws that request.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.
State's Notice of Filing an Amended Information Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute section 971.29, received and filed.
/to Modify Bond, received and filed.

Defendant Salah I. Salahadyn in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a motion hearing. Motion hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
